Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the increase in murders in New York City by not considering the overall decrease in crime rates.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide comprehensive data or evidence to back up the assertion that "murders are up" in New York City.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, as the data from the New York Police Department shows that murders in the city are actually falling.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that murders in New York City have been decreasing, as supported by the data provided by the NYPD.
Falters at times: The claim falters by cherry-picking specific time frames to support the increase in murders, without considering the overall trend of decreasing crime rates.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that "murders are up" without considering the broader context of crime statistics and trends in New York City.
